summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting a batch of discovery materials. The letter details the Bates-stamped ranges of documents being produced, including SDFL files, JPMC documents, database files on Maxwell and Epstein, FAA records, FedEx records, miscellaneous documents, and photographs, many designated as confidential under a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a large batch of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, governed by a protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials including SDFL files, JPMC documents, database files on Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, FAA records, FedEx records, and photographs.
Many of the produced materials are designated as confidential under a July 31, 2020 protective order, requiring specific handling by the defense.
The production includes photographs of Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house.
The government notes some files (SDFL, JPMC) are corrupt, unviewable, or password-protected but are being produced 'in an abundance of caution.'

The letter clarifies a change in marking practice, replacing the word 'confidential' with a label referencing specific paragraphs of the protective order to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
